title: Test: SCM Graph - drag and drop chat context
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/254903

- [x] anyOS @eli-w-king
- [x] anyOS @Tyriar

Complexity: 1


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23258229%0A%0A&assignees=lszomoru)

---

We have added the capability to drag'n'drop a history item from the Source Control Graph view to the Chat view to add it as context.

### Prerequisites
* Install the latest VS Code Insiders release
* Install the latest Copilot Chat pre-release extension

### Add Context
* Launch VS Code Insiders
* Open a folder/workspace that contains a git repository 
* Open the Chat panel in the secondary sidebar
* Open the Source Control Graph view
* Drag a history item to the Chat view
    * Confirm that the history item is attached
* Click on the attached context
    * Confirm that the multi-file diff edior is opened
* Type in a message (ex: Explain the attached commit)
    * Confirm that the LLM is able to use the attached context

title: Ordering of pickString option list when running a debug session is not consistent.

labels.name: *as-designed
labels.description: Described behavior is as designed

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes. I have tested by launching code with --disable-extensions and also specifying the additional --user-data-dir and pointing to an empty directory. - Version: 1.102.2 (user setup) - Commit: c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0 - Date: 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z - Electron: 35.6.0 - ElectronBuildId: 11847422 - Chromium: 134.0.6998.205 - Node.js: 22.15.1 - V8: 13.4.114.21-electron.0 - OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Expected behaviour: The list of options presented to the user when running a debug session that uses pickString inputs should always be in the same order, as it is defined in the launch.json configuration file. Actual behaviour: The actual ordering of the items presented to the user is different from one run to the next, based on whichever option was previously selected. This behaviour was introduced some time ago (I cannot remember when exactly) but I have been ignoring the unwanted behaviour. There is a separate closed ticked which raised this issue previously: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/246664 I suspect the issue was introduced by 930be4a97ecf896af1fbfb7da632bafb9006178e where an LRU cache was introduced to mechanism that resolves input values in the config resolver (see commit message for more details). Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch new code instance: `code --disable-extensions` 2. Create a new debug launch.conf file with a single pickString input with more than 2 items. See example [launch.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21470460/launch.json) 3. Run a debug session (F5) and observe that the initial ordering correctly matches what is defined in the launch.json file: 4. Choose a value other than the default option. 5. Close the browser (if using the example launch.json file) 6. Run another debug session and observe that the ordering of the pickList options has now changed:

title: Test PR view in Chat
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/255383

- [x] macOS @binderjoe 
- [x] linux @justschen
- [x] windows @nguyenchristy

Complexity: 2


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23258212%0A%0A&assignees=alexr00)

---

Setup
- Install the latest pre-release of GitHub Pull Requests and Copilot Chat
- Sign in to both
- Open a folder which contains a clone of a GitHub repo where you don't mind making PRs

Testing
- From the Chat view, ask `#copilotCodingAgent` to make a PR for you
- Verify once the PR has been created, you get a nicely formatted "card" which contains the PR title, link, author, and a snippet of the PR description. Verify that the link opens in VS Code.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
`workbench.editor.enablePreview` is a useful setting that helps me stay focused on the tab I intend to keep open.

However, it can be frustrating when I spend a long time viewing a preview tab (which often indicates I want to keep it) and then it gets replaced as soon as I open another file.

It would be great if VS Code could provide a setting like  
`"workbench.editor.persistPreviewTabAutomatically": 60`  
to automatically convert a preview tab into a permanent one after it has been open or focused for 60 seconds.

title: Adding a screenshot to chat context fails because Blob.bytes() is unsupported in some browsers
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. ### -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.100.2
- OS Version: Chrome (Version 138.0.7204.159)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vscode on Chrome browser and start a coding agent chat with Vision enabled.
2. Click on "Add context" and select "Screenshot".
3. The screenshot is not added to the context and the error "bytes() is not a function" shows up in the DevTools console.

Note: This issue can't be reproduced in vscode.dev because Copilot chat is currently not supported on web.

The cause of this issue is that "getScreenshot()" is using the Blob bytes() method which has [limited browser support](http://go/mdn/API/Blob/bytes)

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/ee89f5176513d851d70e570d65c3d93b4227ecb5/src/vs/workbench/services/host/browser/browserHostService.ts#L653

title: Open file descriptors are leaked in the integrated terminal

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: linux
labels.description: Issues with VS Code on Linux

labels.name: terminal-process
labels.description: Problems launching processes, managing ptys, exiting, process leaks, etc.

body:
We have seen several reports of CRIU failing to checkpoint processes that run in the vscode integrated terminal (https://github.com/checkpoint-restore/criu/issues/641, https://github.com/checkpoint-restore/criu/issues/2698). This happens because vscode leaks open file descriptors to processes running in the terminal, and when CRIU attempts to checkpoint these file descriptors it exists with an error. However, this not only a bug but also a potential security vulnerability in vscode.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open integrated terminal
2. Run `ls -al /proc/$$/fd`

The following script can be used as a workaround to close the leaked file descriptors:
```
FDS=$(find /proc/$BASHPID/fd -type l -printf '%f\n')
for n in $FDS ; do
        if ((n > 2)) ; then
                eval "exec $n>&-"
        fi
done
```

body: Type: Feature Request Hi Microsoft & Community, Support for XML, JSON & YAML and its corresponding schema are lacking in VS Code, depending on extensions that are focused on respectively company needs (like RedHat and more). These file formats are easy (XML, JSON & YAML), their corresponding Schemas (contracts) & versions, not so much. I might be missing some formats but EDI and more specialized formats can be left to 3'rd party extension. I've been working on the Back End and with Integration, contracts (schemas) is everything. I've been working with Full Stack (Web Developers) who only cares about the data they get, not if it's correct, they just develop for exceptions as they come along, costly. A new API version is not a new contract, schema, validated on the client side. Most Full Stack (Web Developers) don't even know what a contract, schema is and what it can do for them. Contract & Schemas are in the way for them. Hence a great support for contracts & instances in VS Code would be great. Fulfilling a contract is crucial to be able to do loose coupling with maintained quality over time. Contracts are developed, integrated and released with the API, WebService, SQL or what not. A major thing in development for quality, stability and blaming is to fulfill a contract, schema. Blaming is the wrong word, I mean find the problem during development, not in runtime, by the End User, Customer. As of today, I can't se a unified front in VS Code to take charge of this problem. The feature needs to work air gaped with contracts & instances stored behind firewalls ( one computer have access to internet, the rest has to work offline). Mighty wish ;-) Wanted per contract & version: Contracts (schemas) One would like to create contracts. Intellisense & completion Validation of contract Run a validation against an instance of data (filestream of choice) with selected contract Instance of data (filestream) One would like to create instances of data (filestream). title: Rename "Editor Inline Chat" to "Quick Edit"

labels.name: *as-designed
labels.description: Described behavior is as designed

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Even after almost two years of using Copilot VSCode extension, I still keep mistaking "Quick Chat" and "Editor Inline Chat" for each other. They are so ambiguously named they essentially sound like synonyms. I would strongly suggest renaming Editor Inline Chat to Quick Edit, which would then be very easy to tell apart from Quick Chat. 

It would much better communicate its true purpose - Quick **Editing** of the code without opening the full fledged Chat side panel. To make UX even better, Quick Chat could also be renamed to "Quick Ask"
If the menu entries were laid as follows:
- Open Chat
- Quick Ask
- Quick Edit

It would be much cleaner and much easier at glance to understand purpose of each of these tools.

title: Cherry-pick OOM fix: Replace AsyncIterableObject with AsyncIterableProducer to prevent memory leaks
body:
This PR cherry-picks commit `504aa2933ed23f2e717e1ba39ed08f32d66e6bde` from PR #256506 to fix issue #257976, which caused VS Code to run out of memory due to inefficient async iteration patterns.

## Problem

The existing `AsyncIterableObject` implementation had a critical memory leak issue where values would accumulate in memory when iterators were created but not fully consumed. This was particularly problematic in scenarios involving:

- Multiple iterations over the same async iterable
- Long-running async operations with frequent iterations  
- Edit telemetry tracking where observables emit frequent changes

## Solution

Introduces a new `AsyncIterableProducer<T>` class that implements a producer-consumer pattern to prevent memory accumulation:

```typescript
// Before: Memory leak prone
const iterable = new AsyncIterableObject<T>(executor);

// After: Memory safe  
const iterable = new AsyncIterableProducer<T>(executor);
```

### Key Differences

- **Single consumption**: Values are consumed only once, preventing accumulation
- **Producer-consumer model**: Direct handoff between producer and consumer without buffering
- **Explicit cleanup**: Proper resource management with final value handling

## Changes

1. **New `AsyncIterableProducer` implementation** in `src/vs/base/common/async.ts`
   - 117 lines of new producer-consumer logic
   - Type-safe error handling with `ProducerConsumerValue<T>` 
   - Async iterator compliance with proper `Symbol.asyncIterator` implementation

2. **Comprehensive test suite** in `src/vs/base/test/common/async.test.ts`
   - 18 new test cases covering all usage patterns
   - Edge case testing (empty producers, concurrent iteration, error scenarios)
   - Validation of the key behavioral difference from `AsyncIterableObject`

3. **Migration of critical usage** in edit telemetry
   - Updated `iterateChangesFromObservable` to use `AsyncIterableProducer`
   - Maintains compatibility with existing `raceTimeout` functionality

## Impact

This fix resolves multiple reported OOM issues:
- #257535, #257539, #256556, #255722
- #256858, #252259, #257788, #257789

The change is backwards compatible and maintains the same API surface while preventing the underlying memory leaks that caused VS Code crashes.

title: Set triggerCommandOnProviderChange default to false to fix #256458
body:
This PR changes the default value of `editor.inlineSuggest.experimental.triggerCommandOnProviderChange` from `true` to `false` to adopt the NES (Notebook Extension Server) provider onchange event as the default behavior.

## Background

The `triggerCommandOnProviderChange` setting controls whether to trigger a command when the inline suggestion provider changes. Based on experimental data showing no significant performance impact, we're now making the "onchange event" behavior the default.

## Changes

- Changed the default value in `src/vs/editor/common/config/editorOptions.ts` from `true` to `false`

## Impact

With this change, when an inline completion provider changes, the code will now:
- Execute the standard provider change handling logic (the "else branch")
- Properly check for active suggestions from different providers before triggering
- Use the more efficient onchange event mechanism by default

This aligns with the existing TODO comment in the codebase that suggests "remove this and always do the else branch", making the intended behavior the default.

Fixes #256458

title: Copilot does not see the output of its commands
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: v0.30.2025072501 (pre-release)
- VS Code Version: Version: 1.103.0-insider
Commit: d8361fecca3b53536de8f7a949b107fb7451e5e6
Date: 2025-07-25T05:03:31.984Z
Electron: 37.2.3
ElectronBuildId: 11993778
Chromium: 138.0.7204.100
Node.js: 22.17.0
V8: 13.8.500258-electron.0
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): agent
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Claude 4 Sonnet
- Logs:

I am not sure of the steps to reproduce this, but the messages are pretty self explained. The agent writes:
```
Let me try running it again but check if there are output issues. Let me create a simpler version of the test that runs step by step:

cd /c/Home/Project && python step_by_step_test.py

The import is hanging. This suggests there might be an issue with the torch/cuda environment. Let me try running with a timeout and then check if it's stuck on CUDA detection:
```
In the mean time, the command has run in the terminal with a correct result.
The agent has not seen the output, so it keeps trying to write other tests.
The terminal runs bash from MSYS2/UCRT64 and there is a prompt to remember the cwd and current environment.

title: Copilot Free: quota not resetting
body: VS Code Version: 1.102.2 Commit: c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0 Date: 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z Github Copilot Version: 1.346.0 Github Copilot Chat Version: 0.29.1 OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 I was using Coplit free, and reached chat quota a few days before July 24. Previously, the message was "Allowance resets July 24, 2025.", but the quota is still not being reset before today (July 28), and the message had changed to "Allowance resets Augest 24, 2025." Logs: ``` 2025-07-28 16:54:54.719 [info] Request ID for failed request: 40998e0e-d3c4-481c-a279-e11d50d9f588 2025-07-28 16:54:54.737 [info] ccreq:e50b5023.copilotmd | quotaExceeded | gpt-4.1 | 2123ms | [panel/editAgent] 2025-07-28 16:54:54.771 [info] Logged in as Meg923a 2025-07-28 16:54:56.075 [info] Got Copilot token for Meg923a 2025-07-28 16:54:56.083 [info] copilot token chat_enabled: true, sku: free_limited_copilot 2025-07-28 16:54:56.131 [info] BYOK: Copilot Chat known models list fetched successfully. 2025-07-28 16:54:56.142 [info] copilot token chat_enabled: true, sku: free_limited_copilot 2025-07-28 16:54:56.164 [info] BYOK: Copilot Chat known models list fetched successfully. ``` tried: 1. update VS Code 2. Sign in & out my GitHub account 3. reinstall the Copilot VS Code extensions other information: This is my first time reaching the quota limit since last year I started using GitHub Copilot in VS Code, and there was no such resetting issue. Possibily same issue with [#4206](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-release/issues/4206), [#5186](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-release/issues/5186)

<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:

title: Fix Pull Request card issue number wrapping in chat interface
body:
The issue number in Pull Request cards was not displaying correctly, with the number breaking across lines or becoming misaligned when the PR title was long.

The problem occurred in the chat interface's PR content part where the title container uses flexbox layout. The issue number link element lacked proper flex constraints, causing it to wrap or shrink when space was limited by long PR titles.

**Changes made:**
- Added `flex-shrink: 0` and `white-space: nowrap` to the `.link` element to prevent the issue number from shrinking or wrapping
- Added proper overflow handling to the `.title` element with `text-overflow: ellipsis`, `white-space: nowrap`, and `flex: 1 1 auto` to gracefully handle long titles

This ensures that:
1. Issue numbers like `#74415` always stay on a single line
2. Long PR titles are truncated with ellipsis when they exceed available space
3. The layout remains properly aligned and responsive

**Before fix:** Issue number could break across lines or become mispositioned
**After fix:** Issue number stays properly aligned regardless of title length

![Original issue showing improper wrapping](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0002ebec-20d1-49d8-aa51-3940410a4a39)

Fixes #258122.

title: Remove hard-coded Python for lsp in terminal
body:
Resolves: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257343
in order to get ready for 
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/249479

This PR intends to achieve: 

Debts:
- Need to remove bunch of hard-coded Python related stuff for lsp in terminal

---------------------
Above is needed so that we can support pwsh completion via lspCompletionProviderAddon https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/249479

Items below should be on separate PR(s): 
- Figure out way to disable pwsh completion provider if lsp is CHANGED TO TRUE. If both are enabled, weird behavior happens currently. 
- lsp Should support pwsh, so we can eventually get rid of pwshCompletionAddon.ts
- Need to handle `rawCompletionToITerminalCompletion` in lsp. Probably differs with `createCompletionItemPython`
- Make sure Trigger character is appropriate for that provider.

title: Fix action view items being too long
body: The filter input textbox might take up large spaces despite the screen being wide enough. If we hit "PROBLEMS" then "OUTPUT", the behavior is normal: However, if we hit "DEBUG CONSOLE" first and then "OUTPUT", all action buttons are hidden in the ellipsis: This is an inconsistent behavior that may reduce productivity. The cause of this issue is that the available width of the left toolbar depends on the width of the right toolbar, which is then computed from `clientWidth`, i.e., the current width. In "DEBUG CONSOLE", the filter input box is stretching (`flex: 1`) to occupy the remaining space, and this space is not freed when switching to the "OUTPUT" tab. The proposed change is to add `getMinWidth()` to supported components like textboxes and select dropdowns. When calculating their widths in layout, use their minimum width first so that other elements can take up more space. After that, they can grow to their desired length in the final rendering.
